fields.summary: Git pull is very slow

fields.description:
It would be lovely if there was a checkbox to turn on/off Pull Requests for a repository.

This is especially helpful for novel uses of forks.
fields.summary: Add repository setting to disable Pull Requests (BB-13552)

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a commit-by-commit view of a branch where it is possible to see which lines of a commit were changed by subsequent commits in that branch.

A commit-by-commit view is really helpful for code review, but the current commit view takes the commit in isolation rather than in the context of a branch.
fields.summary: Ability to see lines of a commit that are overwritten by subsequent commits in a branch (BB-13554)

fields.description:
On OSX, Pull Request side-by-side view button freezes when clicked with Evernote Web Clipper Chrome extention enabled.

If user disable the Evernote Web Clipper extension, the problem goes away. If user try to refresh the Google Chrome tab while it appears frozen, that tab will eventually crash

Note: it doesn't matter if user is signed in or not to the Evernote Web Clipper. Even if sign out of the web clipper, the problem still occurs. The only workaround is to disable or uninstall the web clipper extension.

Google Chrome version: 42.0.2311.135 (64-bit)\\
OSX version: 10.10.3\\
Evernote Web Clipper version: 6.4

It should affect all OSX users that has Evernote Web Clipper on their Chrome.
fields.summary: Pull Request side-by-side view button freezes when clicked with Evernote Web Clipper Chrome extention enabled. (Only applies on OSX). (BB-13549)

fields.description:
Not sure if this is a duplicate, but:

# It is quite normal to want to pull code from a PR for review BEFORE\\
merging it into the repository. User would want to run unit tests for a start,\\
so being able to read the code in the UI is not enough to\\
evaluate a PR.
# Secondly, it would be very handy for the reviewer to be able to alter\\
the PR's parameters before accepting. E.g. someone might request a PR on\\
the wrong branch, it all looks fine but user might want to merge it to\\
another branch.

Being able to get the URI from a pull request would somewhat solve both of\\
these points. There really should be a more direct way of\\
doing this - it should be more obvious in the UI.
fields.summary: Being able to get the URI from a pull request in a more direct and obvious way.

fields.description:
First, click on Compare (Actions on the side bar), Bitbucket shows change between Master (destination) and Branch A (source), Compare then Merged.

Then, click again on Compare (Actions on the side bar), Bitbucket shows Master (destination) and Master (source).

Bitbucket should show changes between Master and other branch instead of the one just recently merged.

Users may have many branches as source and they have to change one by one to see what is changed.

!3654071731-branchcompare.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Compare View: Don't default to comparing main branch to itself if other branches are available (BB-13550)

fields.description:
The link to get the RSS feed for What's New leads to a 500 error with an error code.

https://bitbucket.org/whats-new/rss
fields.summary: What's New RSS link leads to a 500 error. (BB-12877)

fields.description: A few minutes ago cloning a git repo was very slow, counting objects on remote took a long time and downloading objects was very slow too.  It seems much better now but still not really that fast, much slower than the same repo in github...
fields.summary: Cloning slow again

fields.description:
I am having issues on multiple repositories - I follow GitFlow scheme using button helpers in Bitbucket, but all branches and commits appear to be a single branch.

See the attached file:

# I created master and develop
# I did some commits in develop
# I created a feature branch Signup, did a testing commit
# *Then i created another feature branch (feature/test) and did a commit - all via command line* - this commit (and only this one) is displayed as in a different branch
# Then I merged all feature branches to develop (via command line) - apparently it worked
# Then I merged develop into master (via command line) and it still show something else, than what I would have expected.

Am I doing something wrong?
fields.summary: Branches created in Bitbucket don't show up
cannot  clone a repo

fields.description:
What Python-Markdown extensions are enabled? It would be nice to mention that on https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/View+and+edit+pages

(I am creating an issue instead of searching the Answers site or other forums because I consider it a documentation shortcoming.)
fields.summary: Docs for wiki do not mention enabled Python-Markdown extensions (BB-13556)

fields.description:
Hi,

Many of the times, while we are using {{Compare}} feature for two different branches, {{Merged Pull Requests}} feature doesn't work. I could not define the exact situation or reason to find the root cause of the problem, constantly it doesn't work.

Let me give an example for this type of issue;

We use {{master}} and {{integration}} branches. {{integration}} branch is the last stop before _go-to-production_ and we merge {{feature branches}} into {{integration}} branch and then {{integration}} branch into {{master}} branch. And before  _go-to-production_ phase, I check whether I am doing everything correctly. For this last check, I open {{Compare}} branch page and choose {{master}} and {{integration}} ( {{integration}}-to-{{master}}). But, I see only some  of the pull requests in the merge pull requests, but I can't see many of them. Sometimes, I don't see any pull requests in that tab. But, when I check that branch, I am sure that those pull requests are merged to the {{integration}} branch.

Example link: https://bitbucket.org/<company-name>/<project-name>/branches/compare/<branch-name>%0D<master-branch>#pull-requests

I hope, I explain it clearly.

Thanks,\\
Murat
fields.summary: Merged Pull Requests tab in Compare View tab does not display all expected pull requests (BB-13551)

fields.description:
It would be better to have a search bar for {{merged pull requests page}}.

Since, active pull requests page doesn't contain more than 1 page pull requests _generally_, it is not necessary to have a {{search bar}} for a pull request. But, for {{merged pull requests page}}, there are many merged pull requests and that is getting bigger day-by-day. When I want to look at a merged pull request with a keyword that is only thing that I remember about the related pull request, I can not use any search function, yet. I have to go through all pages manually.
fields.summary: Search bar for Merged Pull Requests page.

fields.description: recordSet->Select("") yapılan yerler düzeltilecek.
fields.summary: recordSet optimizasyonu

fields.description:
When you have a new forked (current) repo and you create a pull request that pull request is incorrectly pointing to the original repo and not to the current repo.\\
This is very confusing and it is extremely easy to get it wrong.\\
There is no way to set the default target repo to be the current forked repo instead of the original repo. (I have searched for a solution and asked the support too... )

1 - the default should be the current repo not the original repo (bug)\\
2 - you should be able to set the default repo in the settings (enhancement)

In my case, there is NO intention to ever merge the repos back together again.\\
Dont want to manually have to change this every time in the provided drop down since it is very error prone (easy to forget)
fields.summary: Ability to configure default destination repository for PRs opened from forks

fields.description:
Platform: Windows 8.1 + IE11

Steps to reproduce:

# Open https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/overview
# Click any filters, like {{All}}  {{Watching}}  {{Mine}}  {{Teams}}
# The list then keep refreshing again and again

Workaround: Click the refresh button of the browser.
fields.summary: dashboard/overview filtered list keep refreshing in IE11 after switching (BB-12878)

fields.description: Please can snippets be embeddable. It would be so useful.
fields.summary: Embed Snippets

fields.description:
When I am pressing button "upload" the image is not uploaded, but in browser console there are some errors

Remote Address:131.103.20.167:443

Request URL:https://bitbucket.org/xhr/binarygears/wiki/image-upload/

Request Method:POST

Status Code:404 NOT FOUND
fields.summary: Problems with uploading images

fields.description:
Obviously a read-only deployment key is all about creating code on a build server. One challenge for us that makes deployment keys unusable is that our build server pushes _tags_ when a build has completed successfully.

It would be nice to allow deployment keys to push tags to a repository.
fields.summary: Allow deployment keys to push tags?

fields.description:
Large pull requests are hard to review. Individual commits are much simpler. However, comments on a commit are lost when the branch is rebased. So all comments need to be on the pull request. My team makes a lot of use of re-basing when updating branches based on code reviews.

My current workflow:

# Open the pull request in two tabs
# In one tab, go to the commit section, go to a commit, and review the code.
# When I have a comment to make, go to the other tab and find the same change in the "overview" section - add my comment there.
# Repeat. Unless I accidently makea  comment on the commit - then delete the comment, re-create it on the pull request.

I would love to see something that makes this workflow a lot simpler.

TL;DR - Allow me to review individual commits, but comment on the overall pull request.
fields.summary: Better Pull Request Review Workflow (BB-12807)

fields.description:
When showing a commit on the bitbucket interface, the renames are not detected at all when printing the summary and diff.

I don't know how this view is generated, but it looks a bit like the default {{git show}} behavior, as to be compared to {{git show --find-renames}} which produces way lighter and readable diffs in case of files renamed.
fields.summary: Support for file renames in diffs (BB-11906)

fields.description: When you are viewing a pull request with ignore whitespace feature enabled (?w=1), in certain circumstances proper diff chunks that change more than whitespaces are ignored.
fields.summary: "Ignore whitespace" feature ignoring non-whitespace changes (BB-12794)
wiki urls broken?

fields.description:
I have two wikis on two different repos.  This afternoon the internal links that are auto-generated by the [TOC] tag give me the following error:

404 "Oops, you've found a dead link. Use the links at the top to get back."
fields.summary: Wiki-[TOC] links take you to a 404 page (started this afternoon)

fields.description:
* Create a new git repo
* push a branch to the git repo with a branch that is not master
* note that default branch is not populated

It would be ideal that the default branch would be set to the first branch pushed (or the only branch in the repo.
fields.summary: Default branch is not populated

fields.description: When you are viewing a pull request, the page can get very long.  Often times, there are also ling individual changes that could be folded up to save space and time.  For example, someone could delete some large vendor file tha tis thousands of lines long.  I know this change is ok but yet I need to scroll many times to get past it.  It would be much easier if I could just fold that file up to get it out of the way..
fields.summary: Add ability fold close/open (minimize) files on pull request views. (BB-12809)
Consistently Getting " error: RPC failed; result=22, HTTP code = 502 " when cloning

fields.description:
This feature would allow a user to configure a CNAME on a repository. The CNAME would treat the repository as if it were a [static hosted repository|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/MA4zDQ], which we support. This would allow a user to host content on Bitbucket, directly from their repository.

This should not allow a user to direct a CNAME to a repository's landing page, nor account (ie. no Bitbucket login/UI). This could open the user to security issues, as noted in [comments|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/11063/404s-if-your-team-has-a-custom-domain-bb#comment-17284441] regarding the EOL for the current account level CNAME feature.
fields.summary: Support Custom Domains (CNAME) for static hosted repositories (BB-12770)

fields.description:
I think it would be pretty cool if you could minimize some of/all the comment noise in order to focus fully on the code.

This is how it looks now:

!2479601215-Comment.PNG|thumbnail!

This is my concept:

Minimizable comment (*See the minimize button on the top right corner*)\\
!1748955695-CommentMinimizable.PNG|thumbnail!

This is a comment after it has been minimized:\\
!976923755-CommentMinimized.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Option to minimize line comments (BB-12810)

fields.description:
The merge button on branches does not work.  After I choose the branch I want to merge my branch into I click the "Merge" button on the far right but nothing happenes.

This used to pop up a screen confirming the merge but now nothing pops up.

I have tried both FireFox and IE but get the same result.  Please advise.

Thanks,\\
-Scott
fields.summary: The merge button on branches does not work (BB-12806)

fields.description:
Hi,

Snippets content should be searchable, at least text based content should. It would not be\\
practical nor bandwidth friendly to have to get all snippets and then\\
search inside them. As Is, snippets Api limits its application potential, and actually unusable for many types of projects ( like libraries of snippets for communities around frameworks and such)

Regards,

Jean
fields.summary: Snippet Api missing search functionalities (BB-13559)
bower/codemirror/* return 404, cannot edit online with preview. (BB-12797)

fields.description:
On the Pull requests page, I can currently see how many people have approved a given request (marked as a number) and whether I've approved the request myself (marked with a green check mark), but I can't see if all the reviewers of a given pull request have approved it.\\
This would, of course, especially be useful for my own pull requests, as it would quickly tell me if something's ready to merge without me having to open the individual pull requests.

Perhaps it could be indicated by circling the check mark in black, bolding the number of approves, or writing the number of reviewers after the number of approves (e.g., "3/5").
fields.summary: Mark pull requests which all reviewers have approved

fields.description:
When reviewing PRs, I often have to expand the source to see the method or function name for context.

It'd be great if bitbucket could glean it from the source and show the method or function name at the top of each source section.
fields.summary: Show method name at top of each code section in diff view (BB-13561)

Hi,

I mistakenly removed the last admin of a team, now I can't access the team anymore (obviously). I'd like to restore access to the team because I've also lost access to the repo that's in that team.

Please help...

fields.description:
_Steps to reproduce:_

* Create a new Branch, with no commits.
* Check Branches filter in your repository.
* The branch will be shown under merged.

Once the branch has a commit, it will be shown under the Active filter.

First
Create protocol for sending drawing events

fields.description:
Repository image files doesn't seem to show up correctly on readme.md file on repo overview/source section.

If repo is accessed from a link without '/' at the end, image files does not load. E.g: https://bitbucket.org/trginternational/trg.hhc.autobackup

However, if repo is accessed from a link with '/' or '/overview' at the end, image files seems to show up correctly: E.g: https://bitbucket.org/trginternational/trg.hhc.autobackup/ or https://bitbucket.org/trginternational/trg.hhc.autobackup/overview

This issue seems to only happen with images which are linked from image files inside the repo directory, images from other sources (E.g: images linked from other URL) seems to load fine
fields.summary: Readme.md doesn't load repository images if a repo is accessed from a link without '/' at the end (BB-12725)

I am trying to bring an existing project into bitbucket but am stuck with this error. Can you please help me resolve it. Thank you.

The authenticity of host 'bitbucket.org (131.103.20.167)' can't be establi shed.\\
RSA key fingerprint is 97:8c:1b:f2:6f:14:6b:5c:3b:ec:aa:46:46:74:7c:40.\\

fields.description:
##My steps

# I join to http://restbrowser.bitbucket.org/
# Login with my user account
# Select the POST issue comment https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/{accountname}/{repo_slug}/issues/{issue_id}/comments/
# Fill all field required
# Press Send

And the comment is created but the content field not assigned

I try in a team repo

fields.description:
Holding up team; I'm not able to 'approve' or 'reject' a pull request that I've already reviewed but was waiting for a more minor update(s) after original findings unless I drive back to office to hit button on a browser.  Huge impact on team, holding up team progress.  In some cases we're having to "approve", knowing that its not ready, so that it can move along the process, because we know we will be away from desk soon and the issue is pressing or time sensitive.

If the JavaScript will not work for the button on iPhone or iPad, then detect the agent and offer me a crappy old button so I can move the branch along.  I like the segment button, but I need one that works.

* Added a screenshot for clarity, thanks.  Let me know if there is anything I can do to support this effort.\\
I can understand that the 'diff' would be more difficult to fix, (it doesn't show up either), but being able to have access to the buttons is a minimum for "Approve" or "Reject", so we can not block the process.
fields.summary: Bitbucket - Cant Approve or Reject pull request on iphone or ipad when browsing in "Private" mode (BB-12727)

fields.description:
On the pull request overview tab, diffs are shown for each file chunk that has changed. If the file happens to be over 10,000 lines, the small ellipsis button that shows more context around the diff'ed area, does not work. I see the pinwheel pop up next to the ellipsis, denoting an asynchronous request has been sent, but nothing else happens.

To be clear, it is not when the diff'ed section is over 10,000 lines. It happens when the file being diff'ed is over 10,000.
fields.summary: Can't expand the amount of context around a diff'ed area when the file is over 10,000 lines. (BB-12744)

fields.description:
Hello,\\
Thanks a lot for Bitbucket! :)\\
Because we use pull requests a lot with my team, it would be super appreciable that in the list of pull requests of a repository, the concerned git branch appears in that list.\\
Example : when there are many pull requests in the list, and I'm looking for the one on the branch develop, I don't have this information, and it would be great to have it.\\
Thanks a lot for reading,\\
Pierre Pigeau
fields.summary: Add branch name in pull requests list (BB-12728)

fields.description:
h1. summary
In [project=rst_link_test|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/rst_link_test] I observe that relative links in reST files work only as follows:

# from {{README}} files, viewed as overview pages:

#* links to {downloads, issues, wikipages} work [iff|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/If_and_only_if] the project name is the first segment in the path (i.e., [{{Bitbucket style}}|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/rst_link_test#rst-header-definitions])
#* "standard" (i.e., Unix-style) relative link paths to reST wikipages work with or without file extensions ({{.rst}})
#* all links to in-repo images fail (except presumably standard absolute URIs, not tested here)
# from other non-wiki reST files, viewed in source context:

#* standard relative links to other _non-wiki_ reST files work, but only with file extensions
#* all links to in-repo images fail (with caveat above)
#* relative links to (reST) wikipages _always_ fail
#* Bitbucket-style relative links _always_ fail
# from (reST) wikipages:

#* standard relative links to {downloads, issues, other wikipages} work
#* standard relative links to project resources (i.e., files in project repo, not wiki repo) fail
#* Bitbucket-style relative links _always_ fail

h1. details
[Note that this issue is probably related to [BB-7521|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/6315/relative-urls-in-readmemd-files-only-work] per [this comment from Ike DeLorenzo|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/6315/relative-urls-in-readmemd-files-only-work#comment-14400835].]

While writing reST files (mostly {{README}}s and wikipages) for several projects, I have noticed much weirdness with relative links. Eventually I decided to write a small but reasonably complex [project=rst_link_test|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/rst_link_test] to exercise different link syntaxes in reST files in different contexts. I obtained the results summarized above: feel free to have a look at the project yourselves.

Note that, IMHO, consistent/robust support for standard relative link syntax is important, to maximize

* utility with documentation processors
* portability to/from other doc stores
fields.summary: reStructuredText relative links work in some contexts, not others

fields.description: Same as title + screenshot https://www.dropbox.com/s/luh2rxtahk2zp6s/Screenshot%20at%2004-12-21.png?dl=0
fields.summary: Weird border for type "task" link (BB-12718)

fields.description:
In the list of commits, when the times displayed in the Date column are shown in the format "N hours ago", the rounding is done wrong. Instead of rounding, it's flooring.

For example, when it reads "2 hours ago" it actually means "between 2h00' and 2h59' ago".

Instead, the "time ago" should be rounded to the nearest integer rather than floored.\\
"2 hours ago" should mean "between 1h30' and 2h30' ago".

I have noticed this in the commit view but it may affect the times shown elsewhere as well.
fields.summary: "hours ago" wrong rounding (BB-12729)

fields.description:
!1083506240-Screenshot_1.png|thumbnail!

as seen in the image, the text is displayed wrong

fields.description:
Like so many others, my account was immediately deactivated upon signing up. I was told to contact support in order to resolve this.

Email account is: maiorano84@hotmail.com

Are you sure your "spam filters" are actually stopping more spam requests than legitimate users?
fields.summary: Account Deactivated Upon Signup

fields.description: Loving new snippets feature. But I think it would be nice to be able to tag snippets. It would make snipped browsing easier, when you have a lot of snippets.
fields.summary: Snippet tagging (BB-12731)

fields.description:
The BitBucket Dashboard shows PR requests that have been approved/not-yet-approved by using a red/green icon, so users must either go to everyone of the PRs to see if they have been approved, or hover over each icon to determine if they have been approved/reviewed.

It would be really nice if a different set of colors, or better yet, a different icon could be used so folks who are color-blind could determine if a PR needs review or not.

More info @ http://www.medicinenet.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=7255
fields.summary: Update Pull Request icons to be color independent for color blind users. (BB-12735)

fields.description:
I just submitted a PR in one of my projects and was surprised to notice that the associated issue got automatically marked as resolved.  I would expect this resolution to be triggered _only_ when such PR gets merged, not just at time of submission.

Not sure you will be able to access the following given that it's a private repo (but feel free to access if you deem it necessary). The concrete case is:

* PR:  https://bitbucket.org/mbari/tethysdash/pull-request/2
* Issue: https://bitbucket.org/mbari/tethysdash/issue/25/

(Of course, we might be actually merging such PR, possibly before you take a look.)

Thanks!
fields.summary: pull request resolves issue

Thank you.

fields.description:
When using git subtree, the links in the web interface for the merge commit are broken. They don't point to the source repository or anything else, just giving an error page.

To reproduce, just follow [instructions|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2013/05/alternatives-to-git-submodule-git-subtree/] to include another repo via subtree and push to origin. Go to the web view to see the merge commit and click on the links for the commits merged in.
fields.summary: git subtree commit links broken (BB-12733)

fields.description: It would be nice to be able to add a commit message when updating files in Snippets just like elsewhere in the web interface.
fields.summary: allow commit message when saving snippet in web interface (BB-12734)

fields.description: I've renamed a repository a couple weeks ago, since then we cannot set the issue's state to fixed via commit message.
fields.summary: Issue fix via commit message doesn't work after renaming a repository

fields.description:
I have a .reg file (Windows Registry Entries) in a repo that stores application settings.

[The containing folder|https://bitbucket.org/isme/scripts/src/38eb5f16fd72/putty/%3Fat%3Ddefault] lists the file called "default_settings.reg".

When I click the file name, I expect to see the content of the reg file presented as plain text, like a .txt file.

The current actual behaviour depends on the web browser.

Chrome renders the content of the file as part of the page, so the plain text formatting is lost. All lines run together. This is inconvenient, because the file is unreadable.

Internet Explorer prompts me to download or run the file. This is dangerous, because it makes it easy to accidently apply the registry settings.

Could you update the source browser to present .reg files as plain text?
fields.summary: Show .reg files as plain text (BB-12736)

fields.description: We removed a team member two months ago, but he informs me that he is still receiving commit notifications from repository updates. I cannot find his user name anywhere in our settings, for any of our projects.

fields.description:
Since a few weeks ago, all comments that are submitted to the S3QL issue tracker seem to require my manual approval before they become publically visible.

This is obviously rather annoying. It would be great if the spam-filter could become less restrictive, or if there was a way to opt-out.
fields.summary: All issue tracker comments need manual approval (BB-12680)

fields.description:
This applies to an account that has more than a page of repositories in the Dashboard, and also using IE11.

When users sign in and got into Dashboard's Overview tab, click on the next button below to view more repositories in the list. It will then trigger a bug that causes the overview page to either kept on refreshing itself endlessly (a flicker), might load back to the first page, or both.

Sometimes it manages to load to the next page. But the bug will then trigger if users click next, or previous.
fields.summary: Dashboard's Overview tab kept refreshing itself on IE11 browser (BB-12738)

fields.description: Most coders are much more productive when using their own preferred code formatting (more than just whitespace variations). However, working together via a repo, they're usually forced to at least read in different formatting, in order to not 'fire changes' on the codebase where in reality they're only 'styling' variations. What about a 'behind the scenes' code formatting on synching with the repo in both directions?
fields.summary: allow multiple simultaneous code formatters not interfering (BB-13548)

fields.description:
I'm using Firefox 37.0.1 on Ubuntu 14.04, and I'm seeing the same thing that was reported in BCLOUD-9391 for Opera; namely that the source code viewer in a pull request is not the full width of the screen:

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1584/added-option-to-show-or-hide-toolbars-and/diff

!2836578629-code_width.png|thumbnail!

Here's another one the exhibits this behavior in my browser:

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/161/windows-clean-build-part-5/diff

Here's one that doesn't:

* https://bitbucket.org/sinbad/ogre/pull-request/503/ogre-scenemanager-destroycamera-the-camera/diff

Apologies if this has already been reported elsewhere.
fields.summary: Source code views in Firefox are sometimes not full width (BB-12741)

fields.description:
(On chrome 41.0.2272.118 (64-bit))

When adding an ssh key:

(https://bitbucket.org/account/user/someuser/ssh-keys/) -> Add Key

I paste in my valid key and hit "Add Key".  The button greys out but nothing happens.  When I check the Javascript Console I see the following:

{code}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot use 'in' operator to search for 'pk' in <!DOCTYPE html>
{code}

followed by the entire HTML page.

If I hit cancel and try again, the "Add Key' Button is still greyed out.  If I refresh I get the same.
fields.summary: Adding SSH key throws Javascript exception (BB-12742)

fields.description: It seems that the spam filter on Bitbucket issue trackers (including private ones) is marking random valid comments as spam, which causes confusion and extra work.
fields.summary: Spam Filter on issue tracker is marking random comments (BBS-18044)

fields.description:
Hey, thanks for responding on [twitter|https://twitter.com/atarzwell/status/586306329200959488].

At work we use bitbucket as our repo for everything, (I'd be happy to provide the name or our account, but I'm not sure if these tickets are public or not. I'm logged in as I submit this with my work account that's associated with out companies team).

At work we try to follow Clojure programming conventions quite strictly, but we've also been hiring a lot. We get many PRs from people who may not know the in's and out's of the style guide, they are technically sound, but have a lot of trivial mistakes (Extra spaces, extra newlines, camelcase function) names and the like. Of course, even experienced developers miss a typo or punctuation error once in a while.

The thought is to have an "Approved with Comments" or an "Pending/Conditional Approval" option as to say:

"I've noticed and commented on some issues, and once they are fixed you will have my approval. I trust you are capable to address these without me double checking, and once you do you will have my approval."

I see it going like this:

*Submitter*:\\
Submits their branch as a PR message.

*Reviewer*:\\
Runs through the changes, and sees there is no technical issues. It looks good, but they have a typo in a log message. It's all good, but I don't want to approve it with that potentially embarrassing and possibly client visible problem.

So I make a comment, but instead of pressing the comment button, I press the "Submit and mark pending". The comment shows up like any other comment.

I don't see any other issues so I approve it. My avatar at the top shows up with a "?" in a yellow circle, instead of the normal green checkmark.

I notice my comment, which has yet to be addressed shows up a slightly more prominent to indicate that I selected the comment to hold up my approval.

*Submitter*:\\
Gets the alert that there is a comment and a pending approval on their PR, they address the issue, push their typo correcting commit to bitbucket and goes to reply to the comment to indicate that it's fixed. They type their message and instead of selecting "comment" as usual, they select the "Comment and mark resolved" option that shows up when replying to to a pending comment.

As soon as they reply they notice the yellow "?" over the commenters avatar turn to that satisfying green check.

*Reviewer*:\\
Notices a message that the submitter has resolved my comment. No action needed.

(As an alternative it could be marked as resolved when the line changes, but that seems to detract from the implied culpability that pressing "I acknowledge and believe I have resolve this as per your comment" that clicking "Mark Resolved" has)

For our case the other stakeholders may be.\\
*Team Lead* (w/Merge permissions):

* Can see that reviewing is close. (They saw it and approve except for these 2 things)
* If all have approved, except for one guy waiting on one trivial comment, they can either override and merge anyway (Jira raised as tech debt for un-addressed comment?), or fix it for the submitter.
* Has a good idea of the team consensus on how close a PR is to being ready to merge.

Alternatives:\\
Instead of a "?" for pending, put the number of comments marked as pending and unresolved by the user.

Perhaps, this is too specific to our particular situation, but for us we work around this by approving anyways and then adding a comment to the PR that states "Approved with comments". Which works, but leads to a lot of time checking every comment, to make sure they addressed them all. Not to mention a team lead who can miss the "with comments" comment, and merge it without it being fixed.

If you know of any way there is any way to do this or something similar with an API I'd be interested as well.
fields.summary: Comment with Approval (BB-12666)

fields.description: I have a powershell file that does not seem to render correctly in the source browser area.  It's missing the UI editor elements.!4252801204-bitbucket-source-error.jpeg|thumbnail!

fields.description:
When creating a project, there's a language type for 'PowerShell', however, there doesn't seem to be one for 'snippets'. Does Snippets use the same language types as repos / projects do?

Also, what about adding 'awk' and 'sed' as language types? Especially for snippets, I can imagine folks putting in tools with this.
fields.summary: no PowerShell language type for Snippets

fields.description:
I kept having a really annoying problem when I would try to create a new repository from code I was already working on locally (rather than create the empty repo first and clone it). I'd follow your really helpful instructions and have my first push fail.

One of my co-workers figured it out: the instructions assume I'm using SSH not HTTPS:\\
!2462388157-BitBucketNewRepo.PNG|thumbnail!

If I double-clutch and go to the clone instructions, grab the https commandline from there and just edit it locally to be 'remote add origin' rather than 'clone', I'm set up right (for me) and my push works great.

I know that SSH is technically preferable but, frankly, is a pain for Windows users and unlikely to be how they are set up when they first come to BitBucket and create their first repository. The problem didn't drive me away because I am an established, happy user. But if it happens to a new user the first time they try the service, they may just go to GitHub and not come back. Which would be a shame because, while I use both, I think BitBucket is highly preferable for my proprietary repos.
fields.summary: Helpful instructions for creating new repo lead to push failure for https users (BB-12650)

fields.description:
Let me start out by saying this is important because I am using BitBucket for a class and we are using the last commit time as proof that a project was turned in on time.

The problem:

I push and the recent activity section shows the correct day but when I view the raw commit page it shows the following day as well as when I use the command git log -1. There may be a reason for this but I need something concrete to show my instructor. Is there a way to show the time a push was made to BitBucket?

Much Thanks!
fields.summary: Latest Commit Time Wrong Using Git Log -1 Command

fields.description:
As a team administrator I want to ensure confidential source code maintained in snippets is not inadvertently exposed as Public.

This could be achieved by an admin feature so that snippets are only created on behalf of the Team and with Team only permissions.
fields.summary: Restrict the creation of public snippets

fields.description:
See screenshot - if you have multiple bitbucket accounts, e.g. account a and b

You receive an invitation for account a

You then access the invitation from a mail client, and you may not know which username you are accepting the invitation for.

If you are already logged in Bitbucket to account b, you could be accepting the invitation for account b instead
fields.summary: Add username, or profile avatar on Accept Invitation screen. (BB-12572)

fields.description:
Hello,\\
Could you please add LaTeX support for the MarkDown support in BitBucket?

Many project include very deep math and adding it will make documentation much easier.\\
Something like the "$ [Latex Code] $" and "$$ [Latex Code] $$" will be great.\\
Just as in StackExchange sites.

Thank You.
fields.summary: Add LaTeX Support in MarkDown Documents (BB-12552)
Cannot commit to my repo. error: RPC failed

fields.description:
When I go to mention a user in the issue tracker in the body or in the comments I feel like the suggestive options should first show users in that Repo or users in that comment thread that begin with those characters instead of all users throughout the entire site. It would be extremely rare for someone to mention a user that they have never encountered on that repo  in any info pertaining to the repo.

I'm sure this is a much bigger undertaking but my thought is that when suggesting users using @ the query first looks at repo users, then at commenters / issue owners on that thread, and THEN all users.

For instance, if I was typing "@Lin" in the comments section here, the first suggested user should be anyone assigned as a user in your repo that begins with "Lin" and then would suggest my user Lindsay AnnB and THEN all other users "@lin" as seen in the screen shot

!771572827-Screen%20Shot%202015-04-03%20at%202.17.47%20PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When using @ to mention a user, the first users that should be suggested should be those in the repo (BB-12564)

fields.description:

"Each project sub-sirectory would act as a self-contained website with its own index.html."

fields.summary: Bitbucket Documentation typo

fields.description:

* Trying to access wiki via the sidebar will lead to a 404.

Note: Wiki pages can still be changed by editing it locally, and then hg push it up to Bitbucket. Hg clone wiki pages works as well.
fields.summary: Wiki in Mercurial repositories cannot be updated/accessed (BB-12518)

fields.description:
Hello,\\
I noticed you proview issue fix for manually marking comments on PR as outdated https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/7172/manually-mark-comments-as-outdated-in-pull

Actualy, we have the opposite problems, sometimes it would be very useful for us to have the option to "see outdated" comments to make keep track of them when the pull request is updated, and make sure that the fix is actually properly implemented. Currently any change will trigger the comment to be "outdated" and therefore it becomes complexe to make sure all feedbacks were followed properly.\\
There could be two way to fix this problem

* Give an option to display outdated comments on the PR overview
* Give an option to manually mark a comments as "not outdated"

This would really help the process of making sure that the whole review expected output is done properly.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Show outdated comments on pull request overview

fields.description:
The following gf-markdown markup is not rendered correctly:

{code}
* Item 1
    - Item 1.1

      ```
      # example code for item 1.1
      ```
    - Item 1.2
* Item 2
{code}

The example code for item 1.1 should be indented to appear below item 1.1. (see screenshot) but it looks like the following:

* Item 1

** Item 1.1

{code}
# example code for item 1.1
{code}
** Item 1.2
* Item 2

In my opinion it's very important to display code correctly in a coding wiki. I can't see how to change the markup to get the code indented.

Best regards,\\
Lars
fields.summary: Code in markdown list is not rendered correctly (BB-12553)

fields.summary: Ability to get all the languages in a repo via an API call (BB-12554)
